newsitem.title: USA: DM Grenfell cuts Mexico in LatAm stock portfolio.
newsitem.headline: DM Grenfell cuts Mexico in LatAm stock portfolio.

text.p: -- Deutsche Morgan Grenfell said on Thursday it had downgraded Mexico to short-term underweight from neutral in its model Latin American stock portfolio.
-- The downgrade was prompted by "politcal turbulence, the volatile fixed-income market and present valuations," the company said in a report.
-- Mexico was reduced to 24 from 28 percent in the portfolio. Brazil was raised by three percentage points and Argentina by one.
-- "While maintaining our fundamental recommendations, investors could take profits" in Coca-Cola FEMSA ; Far-Ben, or Bevides; and Grupo Continental, or Contal, it said.
